DataElement.preferredName: Lung Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Major Decreased Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capacity Laboratory Procedure Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether DLCO was significantly decreased.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lung Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Major Decreased Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capacity Laboratory Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a major decrease (a significant decrease in the carbon monoxide transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood, where the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs) in the lung carbon monoxide diffusing capability test (DLCO).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Property.preferredName: Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Major Decreased Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capacity Laboratory Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: A measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood. During the test, the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs.:Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.:A lung function test result in which the lung capacity to absorb carbon monoxide is decreased.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood. During the test, the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs.
Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.
A lung function test result in which the lung capacity to absorb carbon monoxide is decreased.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
